Topic.Title: Changing the background to an image or solid color

Posts.EditableText: I'm working on Web Editor and I would really like to change my background to something else, let it be an image or another color. Help.
Posts.HTML: I'm working on Web Editor and I would really like to change my background to something else, let it be an image or another color. Help.

Posts.EditableText: Very sorry, squiffy does not allow that sort of thing. Quest does!
Posts.HTML: Very sorry, squiffy does not allow that sort of thing. Quest does!

Posts.EditableText: With the desktop version of Squiffy, it's easy to change the background CSS setting by editing the game's CSS file (after building the game into a website, of course), but this may not be an option when doing everything online.
Posts.HTML: With the desktop version of Squiffy, it's easy to change the background CSS setting by editing the game's CSS file (after building the game into a website, of course), but this may not be an option when doing everything online.

Posts.EditableText: Thank you! I downloaded Squiffy onto my mac and have seen results with editing the CSS file. I still can't seem to get the image working though. Can you show me the code you would use to do it?
Posts.HTML: Thank you! I downloaded Squiffy onto my mac and have seen results with editing the CSS file. I still can't seem to get the image working though. Can you show me the code you would use to do it?

Posts.EditableText: Wait, so what types of urls are you able to use?
Posts.HTML: Wait, so what types of urls are you able to use?

Posts.EditableText: Wait never mind, added Quotation Marks around the URL by accident even though I shouldn't have. Thank you so much for your help!
Posts.HTML: Wait never mind, added Quotation Marks around the URL by accident even though I shouldn't have. Thank you so much for your help!
